line.comment: * SCRIPT NAME: al.zanzal.PwnMi.main
* DESCRIPTION: PwnMi - Station Hacking Interface.
* This script is used to control the state of the artificial life plugin.
* Originally started this mod as an ECS mod, but I don't want
* to introduce conflicts with Pirate Guild 3 so I decided to discontinue
* using ECS. I am so happy though that Serial Kicked released ECS
* Because it did help me to get started and provided something
* that worked during the first few days when everything I wrote was
* broken.
* AUTHOR: Zanzal DATE: 14 December 2013
* ATTRIBUTIONS = Code used from these authors:
* Serial Kicked - Template taken from SK's ECS example 'dummy' scripts
* Gazz - A few lines from one of Gazz's scripts thrown in for good measure
* LICENSE: CC-BY-SA 4.0 International - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode
* These 4 lines I used from Gazz's follow me script. Given that I am not sure how all this
* stuff works yet, I figured I'd take a hint from a vet that this script might get called without a plugin ID or event.
* It looked like a good idea.
* NOTE: I am not sure why other plugins use a stub that registers a different
* script instead of just putting it in the main. Even ECS does it like that...
* Indexes for our plugin global data array to help make code easier to understand.
* Plugin Data Version (according to ecs)
* Plugin Off by Default
* Hacker Rank
* Hacker Experience
* Timer Event Running
* Hacking Comms Range
* Hot Key
* init and reinit are run every time the game loads
* assume this is called by the X3 engine to check if the AL script is running.
* Use this area to process special instructions when the plugin is toggled on
* Register to ECS Comm Key
* dim $setup = 'plugin.zanzal.PwnMi', 'plugin.zanzal.PwnMi.commscript', null, null, [Station], 10, ''
* skip if [THIS]-> call script 'plugin.sk.ecs.register' : setup=$setup
* send incoming message 'Error registering PwnMi. Is ECS installed?' to player: display it=[TRUE]
* Use this area to process special instructions when the plugin is toggled off
* Unregister From ECS
* set global variable: name='plugin.zanzal.PwnMi' value=null
* = [THIS]-> call script 'plugin.sk.ecs.news.clear' : plugin.id='plugin.zanzal.PwnMi'
* skip if [THIS]-> call script 'plugin.sk.ecs.unregister' : plugin.id='plugin.zanzal.PwnMi'
* send incoming message 'Unable to unregister PwnMi script : Script not registered to ECS' to player: display it=[TRUE]
* The event script is called every interval
* I think this is what Dr. Bullwinkle was talking about the chance of AL pileups.
* Although PwnMi doesn't use the timer right now, I'll add a flag just in case for
* later since I might end up reusing this elsewhere.

sval.val: SCRIPT NAME: al.zanzal.PwnMi.main
DESCRIPTION: PwnMi - Station Hacking Interface.
This script is used to control the state of the artificial life plugin.
Originally started this mod as an ECS mod, but I don't want
to introduce conflicts with Pirate Guild 3 so I decided to discontinue
using ECS. I am so happy though that Serial Kicked released ECS
Because it did help me to get started and provided something
that worked during the first few days when everything I wrote was
AUTHOR: Zanzal DATE: 14 December 2013
ATTRIBUTIONS = Code used from these authors:
Serial Kicked - Template taken from SK's ECS example 'dummy' scripts
Gazz - A few lines from one of Gazz's scripts thrown in for good measure
LICENSE: CC-BY-SA 4.0 International - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode
These 4 lines I used from Gazz's follow me script. Given that I am not sure how all this
stuff works yet, I figured I'd take a hint from a vet that this script might get called without a plugin ID or event.
It looked like a good idea.
NOTE: I am not sure why other plugins use a stub that registers a different
script instead of just putting it in the main. Even ECS does it like that...
Indexes for our plugin global data array to help make code easier to understand.
Plugin Data Version (according to ecs)
Plugin Off by Default
Hacker Rank
Hacker Experience
Timer Event Running
Hacking Comms Range
Hot Key
init and reinit are run every time the game loads
assume this is called by the X3 engine to check if the AL script is running.
Use this area to process special instructions when the plugin is toggled on
Register to ECS Comm Key
dim $setup = 'plugin.zanzal.PwnMi', 'plugin.zanzal.PwnMi.commscript', null, null, [Station], 10, ''
skip if [THIS]-> call script 'plugin.sk.ecs.register' : setup=$setup
send incoming message 'Error registering PwnMi. Is ECS installed?' to player: display it=[TRUE]
Use this area to process special instructions when the plugin is toggled off
Unregister From ECS
set global variable: name='plugin.zanzal.PwnMi' value=null
= [THIS]-> call script 'plugin.sk.ecs.news.clear' : plugin.id='plugin.zanzal.PwnMi'
skip if [THIS]-> call script 'plugin.sk.ecs.unregister' : plugin.id='plugin.zanzal.PwnMi'
send incoming message 'Unable to unregister PwnMi script : Script not registered to ECS' to player: display it=[TRUE]
The event script is called every interval
I think this is what Dr. Bullwinkle was talking about the chance of AL pileups.
Although PwnMi doesn't use the timer right now, I'll add a flag just in case for
later since I might end up reusing this elsewhere.
